revision.comment: Note on move and coverage of non-U.S. Army vessels of similar type.
revision.text:
{{WPMILHIST|class=start|B1=n|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|Maritime=y|US=y|WWII=y|WWI=y}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=C|B1=n|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y}} ==Title== Used "(ship)" as this is a type of ship, contains listing of the individual ships and helps place the topic. That might not be the best description and perhaps needs changing. "Ship Type" perhaps? [[User:Palmeira|Palmeira]] ([[User talk:Palmeira|talk]]) 15:56, 11 December 2009 (UTC)
'''27-28 July 2013''' moved to Mine planter (U.S. Army) after removal of [[Hashima-class cable layer]] from "See also" section. While a worldwide piece might be useful the focus here is on vessels of the [[Mine Planter Service (U.S. Army)|U.S. Army Mine Planter Service]] (USAMPS) and its predecessor organization. Attempting to expand that into some sort of worldwide discussion or listing would, in my view, make for a cluttered and unfocused article. A section providing '''brief''' mention and links to analogous vessels in other services is of value and it could be expanded into a bullet list of such services even though only the one immediate case is now linked. If enough other cases and articles become available a worldwide category of something such as "Mine planting vessels" might be useful for association. [[User:Palmeira|Palmeira]] ([[User talk:Palmeira|talk]]) 13:17, 28 July 2013 (UTC)
==Suggestion== Just a quick suggestion, but the citations to websites could be formatted using the {{tl|cite web}} template. This would tidy up the references and remove the long url chains that are currently showing. Also references to the same source can be consolidated per [[WP:NAMEDREFS]]. Cheers. â€” [[User:AustralianRupert|AustralianRupert]] ([[User talk:AustralianRupert|talk]]) 06:54, 10 February 2010 (UTC) :Yes, a better way. [[User:Palmeira|Palmeira]] ([[User talk:Palmeira|talk]]) 13:17, 28 July 2013 (UTC)
